com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store

Class ADLStoreClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store.ADLStoreClient

  • public class ADLStoreClient
extends Object
    ADLStoreClient class represents a client to Azure Data Lake. It can be used to perform operations on files and directories.

                                          AzureADToken token)

        Parameters:
        accountFQDN - string containing the fully qualified domain name of the account. e.g., contoso.azuredatalakestore.net
        token - AzureADToken object that contains the AAD token to use
        Returns:
        the client object

      • createFile

        public ADLFileOutputStream createFile(String path,
                                      IfExists mode)
                               throws IOException
        create a file. If overwriteIfExists is false and the file already exists, then an exceptionis thrown. The call returns an ADLFileOutputStream that can then be written to.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of file to create
        mode - IfExists enum specifying whether to overwite or throw an exception if the file already exists
        Returns:
        ADLFileOutputStream to write to
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error in creating the file

      • createFile

        public ADLFileOutputStream createFile(String path,
                                      IfExists mode,
                                      String octalPermission,
                                      boolean createParent)
                               throws IOException
        create a file. If overwriteIfExists is false and the file already exists, then an exceptionis thrown. The call returns an ADLFileOutputStream that can then be written to.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of file to create
        mode - IfExists enum specifying whether to overwite or throw an exception if the file already exists
        octalPermission - permissions for the file, as octal digits (For Example, "755")
        createParent - if true, then parent directories of the file are created if they are missing.
        Returns:
        ADLFileOutputStream to write to
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error in creating the file

                                    throws IOException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        ADLFileOutputStream to write to. The contents written to this stream will be appended to the file.

      • concatenateFiles

        public boolean concatenateFiles(String path,
                                List<String> fileList)
                         throws IOException
        Concatenate the specified list of files into this file. The target should not exist. The source files will be deleted if the concatenate succeeds.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of the destination to concatenate files into
        fileList - List of strings containing full pathnames of the files to concatenate. Cannot be null or empty.
        Returns:
        returns true if the call succeeds
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error in concatenating files

                          ExpiryOption expiryOption,
                          long expiryTimeMilliseconds)
                   throws IOException
        Sets the expiry time on a file.
        Parameters:
        path - path of the file to set expiry on
        expiryOption - ExpiryOption value specifying how to interpret the passed in time
        expiryTimeMilliseconds - time duration in milliseconds
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error in setting file expiry

                                        throws IOException
        Enumerates the contents of a directory, returning a List of DirectoryEntry objects, one per file or directory in the specified directory.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of directory to enumerate
        Returns:
        List<DirectoryEntry> containing the contents of the directory
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • enumerateDirectory

        public List<DirectoryEntry> enumerateDirectory(String path,
                                               UserGroupRepresentation oidOrUpn)
                                        throws IOException
        Enumerates the contents of a directory, returning a List of DirectoryEntry objects, one per file or directory in the specified directory.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of directory to enumerate
        oidOrUpn - UserGroupRepresentation enum specifying whether to return user and group information as OID or UPN
        Returns:
        List<DirectoryEntry> containing the contents of the directory
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • enumerateDirectory

        public List<DirectoryEntry> enumerateDirectory(String path,
                                               int maxEntriesToRetrieve)
                                        throws IOException
        Enumerates the contents of a directory, returning a List of DirectoryEntry objects, one per file or directory in the specified directory.

        To avoid overwhelming the client or the server, the call may return a partial list, in which case the caller should make the call again with the last entry from the returned list specified as the startAfter parameter of the next call.

        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of directory to enumerate
        maxEntriesToRetrieve - maximum number of entries to retrieve. Note that server can limit the number of entries retrieved to a number smaller than the number specified.
        Returns:
        List<DirectoryEntry> containing the contents of the directory
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • enumerateDirectory

        public List<DirectoryEntry> enumerateDirectory(String path,
                                               String startAfter)
                                        throws IOException
        Enumerates the contents of a directory, returning a List of DirectoryEntry objects, one per file or directory in the specified directory.

        To avoid overwhelming the client or the server, the call may return a partial list, in which case the caller should make the call again with the last entry from the returned list specified as the startAfter parameter of the next call.

        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of directory to enumerate
        startAfter - the filename after which to begin enumeration
        Returns:
        List<DirectoryEntry> containing the contents of the directory
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • enumerateDirectory

        public List<DirectoryEntry> enumerateDirectory(String path,
                                               int maxEntriesToRetrieve,
                                               String startAfter)
                                        throws IOException
        Enumerates the contents of a directory, returning a List of DirectoryEntry objects, one per file or directory in the specified directory.

        To avoid overwhelming the client or the server, the call may return a partial list, in which case the caller should make the call again with the last entry from the returned list specified as the startAfter parameter of the next call.

        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of directory to enumerate
        maxEntriesToRetrieve - maximum number of entries to retrieve. Note that server can limit the number of entries retrieved to a number smaller than the number specified.
        startAfter - the filename after which to begin enumeration
        Returns:
        List<DirectoryEntry> containing the contents of the directory
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • enumerateDirectory

        public List<DirectoryEntry> enumerateDirectory(String path,
                                               String startAfter,
                                               String endBefore)
                                        throws IOException
        Enumerates the contents of a directory, returning a List of DirectoryEntry objects, one per file or directory in the specified directory.

        To avoid overwhelming the client or the server, the call may return a partial list, in which case the caller should make the call again with the last entry from the returned list specified as the startAfter parameter of the next call.

        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of directory to enumerate
        startAfter - the filename after which to begin enumeration
        endBefore - the filename before which to end the enumeration
        Returns:
        List<DirectoryEntry> containing the contents of the directory
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • enumerateDirectory

        public List<DirectoryEntry> enumerateDirectory(String path,
                                               int maxEntriesToRetrieve,
                                               String startAfter,
                                               String endBefore)
                                        throws IOException
        Enumerates the contents of a directory, returning a List of DirectoryEntry objects, one per file or directory in the specified directory.

        To avoid overwhelming the client or the server, the call may return a partial list, in which case the caller should make the call again with the last entry from the returned list specified as the startAfter parameter of the next call.

        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of directory to enumerate
        maxEntriesToRetrieve - maximum number of entries to retrieve. Note that server can limit the number of entries retrieved to a number smaller than the number specified.
        startAfter - the filename after which to begin enumeration
        endBefore - the filename before which to end the enumeration
        Returns:
        List<DirectoryEntry> containing the contents of the directory
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • enumerateDirectory

        public List<DirectoryEntry> enumerateDirectory(String path,
                                               int maxEntriesToRetrieve,
                                               String startAfter,
                                               String endBefore,
                                               UserGroupRepresentation oidOrUpn)
                                        throws IOException
        Enumerates the contents of a directory, returning a List of DirectoryEntry objects, one per file or directory in the specified directory.

        To avoid overwhelming the client or the server, the call may return a partial list, in which case the caller should make the call again with the last entry from the returned list specified as the startAfter parameter of the next call.

        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of directory to enumerate
        maxEntriesToRetrieve - maximum number of entries to retrieve. Note that server can limit the number of entries retrieved to a number smaller than the number specified.
        startAfter - the filename after which to begin enumeration
        endBefore - the filename before which to end the enumeration
        oidOrUpn - UserGroupRepresentation enum specifying whether to return user and group information as OID or UPN
        Returns:
        List<DirectoryEntry> containing the contents of the directory
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

                               String octalPermission)
                        throws IOException
        creates a directory, and all it's parent directories if they dont already exist.
        Parameters:

        octalPermission - permissions for the directory, as octal digits (for example, "755"). Can be null.

      • removeDefaultAcls

        public void removeDefaultAcls(String path)
                       throws IOException
        removes all default acl entries from a directory. The access ACLs for the directory itself are not modified.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of directory to remove default ACLs from
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • rename

        public boolean rename(String path,
                      String newName,
                      boolean overwrite)
               throws IOException
        rename a file or directory.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of file or directory to rename
        newName - the new name of the file/directory
        overwrite - overwrite destination if it already exists. If the destination is a non-empty directory, then the call fails rather than overwrite the directory.
        Returns:
        returns true if the call succeeded
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • setOwner

        public void setOwner(String path,
                     String owner,
                     String group)
              throws IOException
        sets the owning user and group of the file. If the user or group are null, then they are not changed. It is illegal to pass both user and owner as null.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of file or directory to set owner/group for
        owner - the ID of the user, or null
        group - the ID of the group, or null
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • setTimes

        public void setTimes(String path,
                     Date atime,
                     Date mtime)
              throws IOException
        sets one or both of the times (Modified and Access time) of the file or directory
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of file or directory to set times for
        atime - Access time as a long
        mtime - Modified time as a long
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • checkExists

        public boolean checkExists(String filename)
                    throws IOException
        Check that a file or directory exists.
        Parameters:
        filename - path to check
        Returns:
        true if the path exists, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown on error

      • createEmptyFile

        public void createEmptyFile(String filename)
                     throws IOException
        Creates an empty file.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of file to create.
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown on error

      • setPermission

        public void setPermission(String path,
                          String octalPermissions)
                   throws IOException
        Sets the permissions of the specified file ro directory. This sets the traditional unix read/write/execute permissions for the file/directory. To set Acl's use the setAcl call.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of file or directory to set permissions for
        octalPermissions - the permissions to set, in unix octal form. For example, '644'.
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • checkAccess

        public boolean checkAccess(String path,
                           String rwx)
                    throws IOException
        checks whether the calling user has the required permissions for the file/directory . The permissions to check should be specified in the rwx parameter, as a unix permission string (for example, "r-x").
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of file or directory to check access for
        rwx - the permission to check for, in rwx string form. The call returns true if the caller has all the requested permissions. For example, specifying "r-x" succeeds if the caller has read and execute permissions.
        Returns:
        true if the caller has the requested permissions, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • modifyAclEntries

        public void modifyAclEntries(String path,
                             List<AclEntry> aclSpec)
                      throws IOException
        Modify the acl entries for a file or directory. This call merges the supplied list with existing ACLs. If an entry with the same scope, type and user already exists, then the permissions are replaced. If not, than an new ACL entry if added.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of file or directory to change ACLs for
        aclSpec - List of AclEntrys, containing the entries to add or modify
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • setAcl

        public void setAcl(String path,
                   List<AclEntry> aclSpec)
            throws IOException
        Sets the ACLs for a file or directory. If the file or directory already has any ACLs associated with it, then all the existing ACLs are removed before adding the specified ACLs.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of file or directory to set ACLs for
        aclSpec - List of AclEntrys, containing the entries to set
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • removeAclEntries

        public void removeAclEntries(String path,
                             List<AclEntry> aclSpec)
                      throws IOException
        Removes the specified ACL entries from a file or directory.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of file or directory to remove ACLs for
        aclSpec - List of AclEntrys to remove
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • removeAllAcls

        public void removeAllAcls(String path)
                   throws IOException
        Removes all acl entries from a file or directory.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of file or directory to remove ACLs for
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • getAclStatus

        public AclStatus getAclStatus(String path)
                       throws IOException
        Queries the ACLs and permissions for a file or directory.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of file or directory to query
        Returns:
        AclStatus object containing the ACL and permission info
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • getAclStatus

        public AclStatus getAclStatus(String path,
                              UserGroupRepresentation oidOrUpn)
                       throws IOException
        Queries the ACLs and permissions for a file or directory.
        Parameters:
        path - full pathname of file or directory to query
        oidOrUpn - UserGroupRepresentation enum specifying whether to return user and group information as OID or UPN
        Returns:
        AclStatus object containing the ACL and permission info
        Throws:
        IOException - ADLException is thrown if there is an error

      • setOptions

        public void setOptions(ADLStoreOptions o)
                throws IOException
        Sets the options to configure the behavior of this client.
        Parameters:
        o - ADLStoreOptions object that specifies the options to set
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error in creating the file path prefix specified

      • updateToken

        public void updateToken(AzureADToken token)
        update token on existing client. This is useful if the client is expected to be used over long time, and token has expired.
        Parameters:
        token - The OAuth2 Token

      • updateToken

        public void updateToken(String accessToken)
        update token on existing client. This is useful if the client is expected to be used over long time, and token has expired.
        Parameters:
        accessToken - The AAD Token string

      • getSSLChannelMode

        public SSLSocketFactoryEx.SSLChannelMode getSSLChannelMode()
        gets the SSL Channel mode for HTTPS calls made by methods in ADLStoreClient objects
        Returns:
        SSLChannelMode enum values as String

      • getDefaultTimeout

        public int getDefaultTimeout()
        gets the default timeout for HTTP calls made by methods in ADLStoreClient objects
        Returns:
        default timeout, in Milliseconds

      • getExceptionFromResponse

        public IOException getExceptionFromResponse(OperationResponse resp,
                                            String defaultMessage)
        creates an ADLException from OperationResponse.
        Parameters:
        resp - the OperationResponse to convert to exception
        defaultMessage - message to use if the inner exception does not have a text message.
        Returns:
        the ADLException, or null if the resp.successful is true
